docs.text: it was easy to fear the worst .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: begin with a classic 1960's television series , add a big budget and an a-list star in the lead role , and stir .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: script , you ask ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: who needs one , kid . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we've got ourselves a formula .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that was my fear : a bloated monster without any sense of direction .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: then , much to my amazement , everything that could possibly go wrong . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: didn't .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the fugitive is as lean , taut and tense as anything the action genre has produced in the last several years .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: under the direction of andrew davis ( 1992's under siege ) , the fugitive grips you by the throat from the outset and never lets go .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: expect box office to go through the roof , deservedly , and expect an academy award nomination for tommy lee jones .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the premise is a simple one .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: dr . richard kimble ( harrison ford ) is wrongly convicted for the murder of his wife after struggling with the real killer , a man with an artificial arm .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after an escape attempt by some other prisoners during a transfer goes awry , kimble finds himself on the run .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his one goal : to find the one-armed man ( andreas katsulas ) before u . s . marshall sam gerard ( tommy lee jones ) finds him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: where the fugitive surprises the most is the script , by jeb stuart and david twohy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a genre where one is almost always asked to allow leaps of logic , the script repeatedly astonished me with its intelligence , its attention to detail and its respect for the audience .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in an early sequence , kimble sneaks into a hospital to shave of his beard , slick back his hair and change into a lab coat .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: on his way out , a police officer jokingly tells the man he doesn't know is kimble to zip up his pants .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a small moment , but it punches home the urgency of kimble's situation , and exactly what a man concerned about not being recognized might easily forget .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: later , while trying to lose himself in a parade , kimble thinks to drop his overcoat , the most likely way he'd be recognized from behind .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's these details which convince us that when a colleague of kimble's tells gerard that he's too smart to be caught , he may just be right .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: credit must also be given to the special effects and stunt coordinators .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the bus crash which allows kimble's escape is a spectacular sequence , as is a leap from a dam into the water below .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the action is crisp and brutal , and never romanticized .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: special kudos go to director davis for maintaining a relentless pace which underscores the single-mindedness of the two leads .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and what a pair of performances those leads are .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: tommy lee jones is nothing short of brilliant as gerard , because he manages an incredibly challenging feat .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for the first third of the film , there is really no * villain * per se ; kimble is on the run , and gerard is out to find him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it would have been very easy to turn gerard into a malevolent , vindictive inspector javert , but that never happens .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: instead jones plays him as a sharp , committed man who's just doing his job , so that when he responds to kimble's comment , " i didn't kill my wife , " with a matter-of-fact , " i don't care , " we know exactly what he means .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's not his job to determine guilt or innocence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's his job to bring in a fugitive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is a well- written character played with relish by an actor at the top of his form .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the only unfortunate thing about jones' stunning turn is that it's likely to overshadow harrison ford , and that's a shame .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for his entire career , ford has been underappreciated as an actor due to his pigeonholing as an action hero .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , he does a fine job with the less flashy part of kimble , always keeping at the forefront the advantage this man has because of his intelligence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the fugitive could only work to its fullest if the two protagonists always seemed to be on equal footing , and ford is up to the task .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this summer has been loaded with action/suspense films , and most of them have been doing brisk business .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , it's time for clint , sean , and various dinosaurs to step aside .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the chase is on .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my advice is to catch it .
docs.label: positive
